Q - 27 ) Explain character-manipulation functions
Character-manipulation functions are used to change, extract, and alter the character
string.
options:
CONCAT: This function is used to join two or more values together. It always
appends the second string into the end of the first string.
For example:
SELECT CONCAT (‘Information-’, ‘technology’) FROM

SUBSTR: It is used to return the portion of the string from a specified start point to
an endpoint. For example
SELECT SUBSTR (‘Database Management System’, 9, 11) FROM DUAL;
Output: Management

LENGTH: This function returns the string’s length in numerical value, including the
blank spaces.
For example:
SELECT LENGTH (‘Hello Javaworld’) FROM DUAL;
Output: 15
